main event: Several radar targets were observed behind aircraft outbound from Iruuma AFB in Tsushima, Japan on September 23, 1952.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 1 hour and 34 minutes., The objects appeared as rounder shapes compared to normal aircraft., The radar tracking showed the targets trailing approximately 2-3 miles behind the aircraft., Observers noted atmospheric changes possibly affecting the radar presentation., The speed of the targets was estimated at around 1,500 MPH, which is too fast for known aircraft in the area.
witness description: members of the 68th AC&W Squadron during an air defense mission
